description: Claim schemas for probing object localization capabilities with conditional instantiation and verifiable relevance judgment.

claim_schemas.name: Coarse Spatial Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: The [TARGET_OBJECT] is located in the [COARSE_REGION] of the image.

TARGET_OBJECT.description: A visually salient object inferred from the image by the baseline model.

baseline_instructions: Decide whether a visually salient and localizable object exists.
If yes, choose one such object and instantiate the claim.
If no, return NOT_RELATED with an explanation.

claim_schemas.name: Quadrant-level Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: The [TARGET_OBJECT] is located in the [QUADRANT] of the image.

TARGET_OBJECT.description: A visually identifiable object instance selected by the baseline.

baseline_instructions: Assess whether the image can be meaningfully partitioned into quadrants for localization.
Instantiate the claim if applicable; otherwise return NOT_RELATED.

claim_schemas.name: Object Absence Detection

REGION_DESCRIPTION.selection_criteria: Select a clearly distinguishable spatial region in the image (e.g., 'left half', 'upper portion', 'upper-right')

OBJECT_TYPE.selection_criteria: Select a salient object category present elsewhere in the image or plausibly expected in the scene

baseline_instructions: Identify at least one salient object category present in the image or expected in the scene context.
Identify a clearly distinguishable spatial region that is devoid of that object type.
If no clear empty regions exist, objects are uniformly distributed across the image, or no spatial boundaries are distinguishable, return NOT_RELATED.
not_related_conditions: Objects are uniformly distributed across the entire image with no empty regions
No clear spatial regions can be distinguished in the image
No salient object category exists to reason about absence
Image is too cluttered or ambiguous to identify empty regions
common_failure_modes: false positive detection in empty areas

claim_schemas.name: Relative Object Localization

TARGET_OBJECT.description: Target object whose location is to be described.

REFERENCE_OBJECT.description: A distinct reference object used for relative positioning.

baseline_instructions: Determine whether two distinct objects can be identified.
If so, instantiate a relative spatial relationship.
If not, return NOT_RELATED with justification.

claim_schemas.name: Edge or Boundary Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: The [TARGET_OBJECT] appears in the [IMAGE_REGION_DESCRIPTION] of the image.

TARGET_OBJECT.description: A visually discernible object selected by the baseline.

baseline_instructions: Judge whether the region description meaningfully applies to the image.
Instantiate the claim if applicable; otherwise return NOT_RELATED.

claim_schemas.name: Small Object Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: A small [TARGET_OBJECT] is visible in the image, and it is located in the [REGION].

TARGET_OBJECT.description: An object that occupies a relatively small portion of the image.

baseline_instructions: Assess whether any small but localizable object is present.
If uncertain, explicitly state NOT_RELATED with explanation.

claim_schemas.name: Occluded Object Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: The [TARGET_OBJECT], although partially occluded, is located in the [REGION] of the image.

TARGET_OBJECT.description: An object whose visible parts are partially obstructed.

baseline_instructions: Determine whether partial visual evidence suffices for localization.
Return NOT_RELATED only if localization is genuinely impossible.

claim_schemas.name: Regional Object Absence
claim_schemas.claim_template: There is no [TARGET_OBJECT] present in the [REGION] of the image.

TARGET_OBJECT.description: A plausible object category inferred by the baseline.

baseline_instructions: Assess whether absence can be confidently determined.
Differentiate between FALSE and NOT_RELATED.

claim_schemas.name: Existential Localization
claim_schemas.claim_template: At least one clearly localizable object in the image is located in the [REGION].
baseline_instructions: Do not rely on object naming to avoid the claim.
Return NOT_RELATED only if no spatial grounding is possible at all.
